intro: Vochysia calophylla, commonly known as the golden star sycamore, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are often hairy underneath. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. Vochysia calophylla is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
